wikipedia_page.main: Ethel Venton (1891 – February 1988) was an English secularist, Labour Party councillor and animal welfare activist. She was the first female president of the National Secular Society, from 1971–1972, having previously served as a vice-president.

response: *Ethel Venton (June 1971 The Freethinker, 26 June 1971, p205: "Mrs Ethel Venton was the only candidate for the presidency and was duly elected." – 1972)
